pr_title: @TransactionScoped Context does not call @Predestroy on TransactionScoped Beans

timeline.bodyText: Could you clarify why this needs to be a CopyOnWriteArraySet, and perhaps add a comment to the code?
timeline.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: Also, if this instance is meant to be accessed concurrently (which the use of the CopyOnWrite seems to suggest), then the fields perhaps need to be declared final ?
replies.author: Sanne

timeline.bodyText: this could be marked static and final
timeline.author: Sanne
Sanne

timeline.bodyText: these two fields need to be final
timeline.author: Sanne

timeline.bodyText: Could you give this a different name? You're adding two classes with this name; I understand it's not a problem as they are in a different package, but it's a bit unpractical to have two around.
timeline.author: Sanne

timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer this to use a ConcurrentMap, so to not need synchronized on it further below.
timeline.author: Sanne

timeline.bodyText: after making the transactions Map a ConcurrentMap, the synchronized can be removed.
timeline.author: Sanne

timeline.bodyText:
after making the transactions Map a ConcurrentMap, the synchronized can be removed; the following operations can be made atomic with a little bit of care, e.g. using computeIfAbsent instead of get.
Even better, for optimal performance, to a get first, and then resort to computeIfAbsent only if the first optimistic get operation failed.
timeline.author: Sanne

timeline.message: Update TransactionScopedTest to check @PostConstruct and @PreDestroy invocations for TransactionScoped bean

timeline.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: Got it. I've incorporated the suggestion.
